alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 24 at 6:11AM AKDT until March 27 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow, freezing rain, and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch possible. Winds could gust to 40 mph. Very low visibility is possible. * WHERE...Lower Yukon Valley. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Large snow drifts will form. A glaze of ice could make slippery travel conditions. Strong winds could cause damage to buildings and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will develop Saturday evening. The strongest winds will be Saturday night. Freezing rain is possible Saturday evening into Sunday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
